code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: shows a presence of a right upper lobe mass, along with mediastinal lymphadenopathy and multiple small pulmonary metastases
showed increased uptake in the proximal phalanx of right ring finger and likely metastatic deposits in T9 vertebrae and several ribs
showed moderately to poorly differentiated metastatic adenocarcinoma in keeping with lung origin

4.6 x 5.1 x 4.6 cm mass in the aortopulmonary window encasing the left pulmonary artery, a 1.9-cm subcarinal lymph node, and a mass in the left upper lobe of the lung measuring 2.5 x 2.1 cm with suspicious regional lymphangitic spread
shows 2 enhancing cerebral metastases of lung cancer in the left cerebral hemisphere

td.content: s:a 52 yo white male presents with 11 days history of critical posterior thoracic pain on respiration, severe right shoulder pain, moderate loss of appetite and Cancer. o:Height 191 cm, Weight 53.9 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 83, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, Contrast-enhanced CT Chest 4.6 x 5.1 x 4.6 cm mass in the aortopulmonary window encasing the left pulmonary artery, a 1.9-cm subcarinal lymph node, and a mass in the left upper lobe of the lung measuring 2.5 x 2.1 cm with suspicious regional lymphangitic spread, Contrast-enhanced MRI brain shows 2 enhancing cerebral metastases of lung cancer in the left cerebral hemisphere a:Lung Cancer p:administered cisplatin - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, irinotecan - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, performed Contrast-enhanced CT Chest, Contrast-enhanced MRI brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
